string.text: Cartridge casings - Small caliber
Small brass cases with primers used to make small caliber ammunition. These cartridges can be converted into any size from 7.62x25 up to .357 Magnum.
Cartridge casings - Shot caliber
Plastic cases with brass primers used to make shotgun ammunition.
Cartridge casings - Medium caliber
Medium-sized brass cases with primers used to make medium caliber ammunition. These cartridges can be converted into 39mm or 45mm sizes.
Cartridge casings - Large caliber
Large brass cases with primers used to make large caliber ammunition. These cartridges can be converted into any size from 51mm up to .50BMG.
Gunpowder - Small caliber
Fast-burning, two-base propellant powder for use in handgun cartridges. This variant of smokeless powder produces less total energy than slower working powders, but burns cleaner.
Gunpowder - Shot caliber
Fast-burning, two-base propellant powder for use in shotshells. This variant of smokeless powder produces less total energy than slower working powders, but burns cleaner and faster.
Gunpowder - Medium caliber
IMR propellant for light medium caliber cartridges and some heavy small caliber cartridges. This powder burns at a medium speed and produces a good amount of energy.
Gunpowder - Large caliber
High-yield, slow-burning ammunition powder for large-caliber cartridges. This powder provides the most energy and burns the slowest, so it is only suitable for large-caliber long gun ammunition.
Small caliber bullets
Handgun cartridges of various sizes dismantled from ammunition. These will be useful in crafting new ammunition.
Small caliber bullets - AP

Handgun bullets of various sizes recovered from ammunition. These have alloy penetrators embedded in the bullet. Small arms rounds are typically too slow to penetrate armor, even with penetrators, unless a positive pressure powder charge is used or the round is specifically designed to penetrate armor, such as: B. the 5.7x28 bullet.
Shotgun caliber bullets
Small lead pellets used in hunting shotguns. These can also be melted down and cast into large bullets.
Shotgun caliber bullets - AP
Hardened steel arrow surrounded by a sabot. These rounds are fired from police shotguns to disable engine blocks, but also have a good effect on body armor.
Medium caliber bullets
Different sized bullets for medium caliber rifles used in assault rifles. Military manufactured and encased in a full metal jacket optimized for precision.
Medium caliber bullets - AP

Different sized bullets for medium caliber rifles with alloy penetrators used in assault rifles. These are special rounds that can destroy armor at standard distances, but at the expense of effectiveness against human body parts.
Large caliber bullets
Full size rifle bullets covered in a metal jacket. They are commonly used to load cartridges for hunting and military snipers.
Large caliber bullets - AP
Large caliber rifle bullets with embedded alloy penetrators. These cartridges are used by military and special forces to penetrate armor from long distances.
